<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/sponsored/sap/quiz-launch-this-product" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="SAP" style="width:100%;max-width: 79px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="79" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL2NvbXBhbnkvbG9nby82NzcvMTYyNjg3ODY1My1TQVBfQ19ncmFkLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6ImNvbWV0LW1vcm5pbmdicmV3IiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0="></a>
</th>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>With former President Barack Obama turning 60 today, we decided to read the always-interesting "List of presidents of the United States by age" Wikipedia page, and found out some interesting things:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The youngest to assume the presidency was Teddy Roosevelt (42) and the youngest to be elected was JFK (43).</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The median age at inauguration of incoming US presidents is 55 years.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>John Adams was the first of six presidents to live into their 90s. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>At 78, Joe Biden became the oldest newly inaugurated US president.</span></li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/03/sec-chief-gary-gensler-calls-crypto-wild-west-speech?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
There’s a New Crypto Sheriff in Town
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/03/sec-chief-gary-gensler-calls-crypto-wild-west-speech?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="WASHINGTON - NOVEMBER 18:  Commodity Futures Trading Commission Chairman..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MDc3L3NlbmF0ZV9ob2xkc19oZWFyaW5nX29uX3IuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Brendan Smialowski/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Business icon Charlie Munger has called bitcoin “rat poison.” Twitter and Square CEO Jack Dorsey said it could bring about “world peace.” What does SEC Chair Gary Gensler think? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let’s go with somewhere in the middle: “rat peace.” In a <a href="https://www.sec.gov/news/public-statement/gensler-aspen-security-forum-2021-08-03?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">major speech</a> on crypto yesterday, Wall Street’s top cop said he’s intrigued by the technology but wants more regulation to protect investors.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Run the numbers: </strong>Just a dozen years after bitcoin was introduced to the world, the crypto sector has exploded in value.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The market is worth about $1.6 trillion, Gensler said.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>77 tokens are worth at least $1 billion each and 1,600 are worth at least $1 million.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But right now it’s the “Wild West,” according to Gensler. Crypto is “rife with fraud, scams, and abuse in certain applications,” and many investors could get hurt if more safeguards aren’t put in place. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To clean things up, Gensler asked Congress for more resources to police the crypto world, such as the authority to monitor crypto exchanges. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Regulation should be </strong><strong style="color:#000"><em>welcome </em></strong><strong style="color:#000">in crypto, </strong>Gensler said, because it sets guardrails and can pave the way for success. After all, it wasn’t until the government installed traffic lights and speed limits that the auto industry really took off, Gensler <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-03/will-government-regulate-crypto-sec-chair-gary-gensler-on-bitcoin-and-oversight?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told Bloomberg</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why does it matter what Gensler thinks? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As the country’s top financial regulator, he could hand down the most significant rules for the crypto industry to date. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But here’s something you may not know: Gensler is kind of a crypto nerd himself. After working on Hillary Clinton’s presidential campaign, he spent three years teaching a class at MIT called “Blockchain and Money” (you can watch his lectures on video <a href="https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/sloan-school-of-management/15-s12-blockchain-and-money-fall-2018/video-lectures/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>).  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Gensler’s belief about crypto can be summed up in two words—“speculative investment.” He seems poised to let the industry grow, but under more parental supervision. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ For more: </strong>If you're curious about investing in crypto, here's a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/03/wanna-cryptonaire?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">quick primer</a> on the dos and don'ts.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/03/nyc-tyson-microsoft-announce-vaccine-mandates?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Vax and the City
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/03/nyc-tyson-microsoft-announce-vaccine-mandates?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A sign asking patrons to wear a face mask is seen at the entrance of a r..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MDgwL3VzLWhlYWx0aC12aXJ1cy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Kena Betancur/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">New York City became the first major US city to <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/03/nyregion/nyc-vaccine-mandate.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">require vaccines</a> for indoor activities. Mayor Bill de Blasio said yesterday that proof of vaccination will be required at all indoor venues including bars, gyms, Broadway shows, and Marie’s Crisis, which combines all three.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Children under 12, who don’t have a federally authorized vaccine available yet, are excluded from the requirement. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Meanwhile, masks won’t be required indoors because, according to de Blasio, they could disincentivize New Yorkers from getting the vaccine. That approach differs from other cities like San Francisco and New Orleans, which have reinstated indoor mask mandates.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Plus, more companies introduced vaccine rules</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Microsoft joined other Big Tech companies in <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/8/3/22607690/microsoft-proof-vaccination-covid-19-us-buildings-office-reopening?scrolla=5eb6d68b7fedc32c19ef33b4" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">requiring workers</a> to be vaccinated to work at its offices.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Meat supplier Tyson will require all of its 120,000 US workers to be vaccinated. Tyson’s announcement stands out because, so far, most vaccine mandates have <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/08/03/business/tyson-walmart-disney-vaccine-mandate-workers/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">only applied</a> to corporate workers, not employees on the front line. That divide’s best illustrated by Walmart, where only corporate workers need to show proof of vaccination.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/03/beijing-calls-online-gaming-opium-mind-shares-tencent-plunge?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Tencent Meets Its Toughest Boss Yet
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="video game " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=401 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/JUSwkiO1Eh5K43ruN0/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="video game " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/JUSwkiO1Eh5K43ruN0/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">China’s crackdown on tech companies has claimed another victim: Tencent, the owner of Riot Games and maker of <em>Honor of Kings</em>, the world’s top-grossing game in 2019 and 2020.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A state-owned newspaper <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/tencent-plummets-as-china-takes-aim-at-online-videogames-11627962018?campaign_id=4&emc=edit_dk_20210803&instance_id=36960&mod=pls_whats_news_us_business_f&nl=dealbook&regi_id=83342785&segment_id=65203&te=1&user_id=6e8f5c5256f51c870f4df90ca819260d" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wrote</a> on Tuesday that gaming addiction in China was on the rise and labeled it “opium for the mind.” The article, which deleted the reference to opium later, fueled investor fears of potential regulation and sent Tencent’s shares sliding more than 10% yesterday. Tencent <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-03/tencent-plummets-as-chinese-crackdown-fears-persist?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">responded</a> by banning all in-game purchases for minors and tightening the time limit on play for kids. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters</strong>: In recent months, the Chinese government has intensified its scrutiny of the country’s tech giants over data security and monopoly concerns. Nine of the top 10 market value losers in July are Chinese firms, per Bloomberg. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tencent may not be a household name in the US, but its fingerprints are all over the American tech industry. Its investment stakes include...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>40% of </span><span><em>Fortnite </em></span><span>maker Epic Games </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>12% of Snap </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>5% of Tesla  </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>5% of Activision Blizzard </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line</strong>: International investors burned by China’s regulatory bombshells have lost more than <a href="https://www.smh.com.au/business/markets/china-s-tech-crackdown-has-wiped-out-trillions-and-could-shut-a-crucial-door-to-the-us-20210803-p58feg.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$1 trillion</a> this year.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So you know what’s needed to take your business to the next level. But if you’re not sure how to give that baby wings, it could feel like, “Houston, We have a problem.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Or maybe you’re the one leading the strategy or design or marketing for your business every day. But do you really understand all the pieces, technology, and people that need to come together to make it a reality? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you’re breaking out into a cold sweat, don’t fret. We <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/sponsored/sap/quiz-launch-this-product" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">made a quiz for you</a> to test your ability to implement products that can scale without the pressure. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus our partners at <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/sponsored/sap/quiz-launch-this-product" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">SAP sprinkled tips throughout</a> to help you along the way—they’re committed to helping businesses all around the world run at their best every day. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Who knows, maybe you eventually launch an IRL product that is a rocket ship. If that’s the case, we’d like 98 tickets please and thank you.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/sponsored/sap/quiz-launch-this-product" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Take the quiz</a>. </p>

Key Performance Indicators

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat</strong>: Business travelers are responsible for 55%–75% of major airlines’ profits despite accounting for 10% of all passengers, industry experts told the NYT. And at major hotel chains like Marriott and Hilton, business travelers account for 70% of global revenue. So when will they come back? <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/13/business/business-travel-hotels-airlines.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">It could be years</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote</strong>:<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>“I had no work experience, life experience, anything like that before I signed on to this quarter-million-dollar loan. I thought I would come out making much more than I did.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Dylan Boigris, a 2016 Miami Law graduate, began his career making about $45,000 as a public defender. With tuition rising and salaries...doing the opposite, law school is losing its luster, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/law-school-student-debt-low-salaries-university-miami-11627991855?mod=hp_lead_pos5" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the WSJ reports</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>A profile of the original influencer, Sean Combs. (<a href="https://www.vanityfair.com/style/2021/08/from-puff-daddy-to-diddy-to-love?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vanity Fair</a>)</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD AND BEVERAGE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/03/pepsico-plans-sell-off-tropicana-naked-juice-brands?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Pepsi Decides Juice Ain’t Worth the Squeeze
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/03/pepsico-plans-sell-off-tropicana-naked-juice-brands?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Pouring a orange juice mimosa" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/xT0GqEACvHo31kSOFq/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Pouring a orange juice mimosa" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/xT0GqEACvHo31kSOFq/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sipping OJ while reading this? You’re an endangered species.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After seeing fruit juice sales <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/business/consumer/pepsico-sell-tropicana-other-juice-brands-3-3-billion-n1275797?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">steadily decline</a> over the years, PepsiCo has decided to squeeze juice brands out of its portfolio. It’s selling a controlling stake in Tropicana, Naked, and its other juice brands to a French private equity firm for $3.3 billion.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Tropicana may be the most popular refrigerated OJ in the US, but it can’t fight an ebbing tide for fruit drinks overall. Fruity beverage consumption in the US fell 19% between 2011–2020, per Beverage Marketing Corp. Pepsi’s juice sales soured even faster, dropping 36% over the same period.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Blame it on the C6H12O6 </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Despite a brief uptick in fruit juice sales last year (Vitamin C for immunity, more time for breakfast), the category <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/pepsico-to-sell-tropicana-naked-juice-brands-to-private-equity-firm-11627984801?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is suffering</a> the same long-term decline as sugary cereals. Big Beverage has responded to customers’ aversion to “-ose” ingredients by shifting away from sweet drinks and toward seltzers, bottled water, and diet sodas. Coca-Cola discontinued its smoothie and juice brand Odwalla last year, along with other underperforming brands.</p>

style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThere’s a New Crypto Sheriff in Town\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"WASHINGTON - NOVEMBER 18:  Commodity Futures Trading Commission Chairman...\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eBrendan Smialowski/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBusiness icon Charlie Munger has called bitcoin “rat poison.” Twitter and Square CEO Jack Dorsey said it could bring about “world peace.” What does SEC Chair Gary Gensler think? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLet’s go with somewhere in the middle: “rat peace.” In a \u003ca href=\"https://www.sec.gov/news/public-statement/gensler-aspen-security-forum-2021-08-03?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emajor speech\u003c/a\u003e on crypto yesterday, Wall Street’s top cop said he’s intrigued by the technology but wants more regulation to protect investors.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRun the numbers: \u003c/strong\u003eJust a dozen years after bitcoin was introduced to the world, the crypto sector has exploded in value.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe market is worth about $1.6 trillion, Gensler said.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e77 tokens are worth at least $1 billion each and 1,600 are worth at least $1 million.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut right now it’s the “Wild West,” according to Gensler. Crypto is “rife with fraud, scams, and abuse in certain applications,” and many investors could get hurt if more safeguards aren’t put in place. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTo clean things up, Gensler asked Congress for more resources to police the crypto world, such as the authority to monitor crypto exchanges. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRegulation should be \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cem\u003ewelcome \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ein crypto, \u003c/strong\u003eGensler said, because it sets guardrails and can pave the way for success. After all, it wasn’t until the government installed traffic lights and speed limits that the auto industry really took off, Gensler \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-03/will-government-regulate-crypto-sec-chair-gary-gensler-on-bitcoin-and-oversight?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold Bloomberg\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy does it matter what Gensler thinks? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs the country’s top financial regulator, he could hand down the most significant rules for the crypto industry to date. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut here’s something you may not know: Gensler is kind of a crypto nerd himself. After working on Hillary Clinton’s presidential campaign, he spent three years teaching a class at MIT called “Blockchain and Money” (you can watch his lectures on video \u003ca href=\"https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/sloan-school-of-management/15-s12-blockchain-and-money-fall-2018/video-lectures/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehere\u003c/a\u003e).  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eGensler’s belief about crypto can be summed up in two words—“speculative investment.” He seems poised to let the industry grow, but under more parental supervision. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ For more: \u003c/strong\u003eIf you're curious about investing in crypto, here's a \u003ca collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNew York City became the first major US city to \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/03/nyregion/nyc-vaccine-mandate.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erequire vaccines\u003c/a\u003e for indoor activities. Mayor Bill de Blasio said yesterday that proof of vaccination will be required at all indoor venues including bars, gyms, Broadway shows, and Marie’s Crisis, which combines all three.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eChildren under 12, who don’t have a federally authorized vaccine available yet, are excluded from the requirement. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMeanwhile, masks won’t be required indoors because, according to de Blasio, they could disincentivize New Yorkers from getting the vaccine. That approach differs from other cities like San Francisco and New Orleans, which have reinstated indoor mask mandates.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003ePlus, more companies introduced vaccine rules\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMicrosoft joined other Big Tech companies in \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/8/3/22607690/microsoft-proof-vaccination-covid-19-us-buildings-office-reopening?scrolla=5eb6d68b7fedc32c19ef33b4\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erequiring workers\u003c/a\u003e to be vaccinated to work at its offices.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMeat supplier Tyson will require all of its 120,000 US workers to be vaccinated. Tyson’s announcement stands out because, so far, most vaccine mandates have \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/08/03/business/tyson-walmart-disney-vaccine-mandate-workers/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eonly applied\u003c/a\u003e to corporate workers, not employees on the front line. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSipping OJ while reading this? You’re an endangered species.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter seeing fruit juice sales \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/business/consumer/pepsico-sell-tropicana-other-juice-brands-3-3-billion-n1275797?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esteadily decline\u003c/a\u003e over the years, PepsiCo has decided to squeeze juice brands out of its portfolio. It’s selling a controlling stake in Tropicana, Naked, and its other juice brands to a French private equity firm for $3.3 billion.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eTropicana may be the most popular refrigerated OJ in the US, but it can’t fight an ebbing tide for fruit drinks overall. Fruity beverage consumption in the US fell 19% between 2011–2020, per Beverage Marketing Corp. Pepsi’s juice sales soured even faster, dropping 36% over the same period.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBlame it on the C6H12O6 \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDespite a brief uptick in fruit juice sales last year (Vitamin C for immunity, more time for breakfast), the category \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/pepsico-to-sell-tropicana-naked-juice-brands-to-private-equity-firm-11627984801?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eis suffering\u003c/a\u003e the same long-term decline as sugary cereals. Big Beverage has responded to customers’ aversion to “-ose” ingredients by shifting away from sweet drinks and toward seltzers, bottled water, and diet sodas. Coca-Cola discontinued its smoothie and juice brand Odwalla last year, along with other underperforming brands.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\"
